result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:17 AM Defendant Thomas J Boersma in court.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court for Thomas J Boersma.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court addresses amended information in 22CF921.
Defense acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Defense requests time to pursue issues with the case.
Court reviews WCS letter.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Laboratory Report
Hearing on August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day of being released.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/explosives.

Arguments by the Defense.
Arguments by the State.
Court grants motion and orders cash bail reduced to $1500.00.  All conditions to remain as previously set.

08:17 AM Defendant Thomas J Boersma in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Trooper Colton Bahling, of the Wisconsin State Patrol, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Will.
Cross examination by attorney Martinez.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:28 AM Defendant Thomas J Boersma in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
